conversion of approximately 10%.\"\n          [15] \"Since several of the previously postulated oxygen species were paramagnetic, we applied EPR spectroscopy under controlled atmosphere conditions in order to experimentally identify oxygen species formed from gaseous N2O and O2 over VOx/MCM-41 and to explore the reactivity of these species towards oxidation of C3H8, C3H6, and CO.\"", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been shown to significantly improve propene selectivity in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) compared to molecular oxygen (O2) when used as an oxidant. This improvement has been observed over various catalysts, including steam-activated iron-containing zeolites, bulk vanadium oxides, and supported vanadium-containing materials. A similar effect of N2O has also been reported for the oxidative dehydrogenation of n-butane over vanadium magnesium oxide catalysts. The positive effect of N2O on the ODHP reaction is attributed to the slower reoxidation of reduced VOx species compared to O2, resulting in a lower steady-state concentration of active lattice oxygen sites and thus suppressing the consecutive oxidation of propene to carbon oxides. However, the activity of VOx sites for consecutive propene oxidation increases with rising agglomerization degree. Propene selectivities do not differ much as long as the vanadium surface concentration remains below monolayer coverage, with only isolated VOx sites and small two-dimensional VxOy clusters present. When V2O5 nanocrystallites dominate, there is a dramatic drop in propene selectivity and direct total oxidation of propane occurs with both oxidants, although this detrimental effect is less pronounced in the presence of N2O. A recent study suggested that compared to N2O, other oxygen species (non-lattice oxygen of VOx species) are formed from gas-phase O2 and participate in COx formation. However, there is limited experimental information on the nature of active oxygen species formed from O2 and N2O upon reoxidation of reduced VOx species. The aim of this study is to obtain experimental evidence on the nature and structure of oxygen species formed upon reoxidation of reduced highly dispersed VOx species supported over MCM-41 with O2 and N2O. The same VOx/MCM-41 catalyst used in this work has previously been thoroughly characterized and tested in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane. A turnover frequency of propane conversion of 0.016 molC3H8 mol1 V s1 has been measured with O2 used as an oxidizing agent. In comparison, the respective value with N2O was only half as high, while the propene selectivity was higher, amounting to 80% with N2O but only to 50% with O2 at propane conversion of approximately 10%. Since several of the previously postulated oxygen species were paramagnetic, EPR spectroscopy under controlled atmosphere conditions was applied to experimentally identify oxygen species formed from gaseous N2O and O2 over VOx/MCM-41 and to explore the reactivity of these species towards oxidation of C3H8, C3H6, and CO.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮(N2O)作为氧化剂在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中使用时,与氧气(O2)相比,显著提高了丙烯选择性。这种改善在各种催化剂上都有观察到,包括蒸汽活化铁含沸石、块状钒氧化物和含钒支撑材料。N2O对n-丁烷氧化脱氢的类似效果也已在钒镁氧化物催化剂上报道。N2O对ODHP反应的积极作用归因于与O2相比,VOx物种的还原态的再氧化速率较慢,导致活性晶格氧位点的稳态浓度较低,从而抑制了丙烯向二氧化碳的连续氧化。然而,VOx位点对连续丙烯氧化的活性随着聚集度的增加而增加。只要钒表面浓度保持在单层覆盖以下,丙烯选择性差异不大,只有孤立的VOx位点和小的二维VxOy簇存在。当V2O5纳米晶占主导时,不仅丙烯选择性急剧下降,而且在两种氧化剂存在下,丙烷的直接完全氧化都会发生,尽管在N2O存在下,这种不利影响不那么明显。最近的一项研究指出,与N2O相比,从气相O2中形成的其他氧物种(VOx物种的非晶格氧)参与了COx的形成。然而,关于从O2和N2O还原VOx物种时形成的活性氧物种的性质,只有有限的实验信息。本研究的目的是获得实验证据,证明在O2和N2O存在下,在MCM-41上还原的高分散VOx物种的性质和结构。本研究中使用的VOx/MCM-41催化剂以前已在丙烷氧化脱氢中进行了彻底的表征和测试。使用O2作为氧化剂时,测得的丙烷转化率的周转频率为0.016 molC3H8 mol1 V s1。相比之下,N2O的相应值仅为一半,而丙烯选择性更高,在丙烷转化率约为10%时,丙烯选择性为80%,而O2仅为50%。由于以前假设的几种氧物种具有顺磁性,因此在受控气氛条件下应用了EPR光谱,以实验上识别从气相N2O和O2在VOx/MCM-41上形成的氧物种,并探索这些物种对C3H8、C3H6和CO氧化的反应性。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.jcat.2010.06.010"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"A recent study has shown the superior performance of steam-activated Fe-zeolites in the N2O-mediated propane oxidative dehydrogenation, Eq. (1) (Prez-Ramrez and Kondratenko, 2003; Prez-Ramrez and Gallardo-Llamas,2004). Initial propene yields of 24% at 773798 K were achieved, comparable with the highest values reported over V and Mo-based catalysts with O2.\"\n          [2] \"The remarkable performance of Fe-zeolites has been related to the specificity of N2O as a monooxygen donor and the capability of determined iron forms in the zeolite for coordinating reactive atomic oxygen species able to efficiently dehydrogenate propane\"\n          [3] \"A major draw- back of Fe-zeolites in ODHP with N2O is the deactivation by coke. This causes a rapid decrease of the propene yield, al- though the original catalytic activity was completely recov- ered after regeneration in pure oxygen at 773 K for 30 min (Prez-Ramrez and Kondratenko, 2003).\"\n          [4] \"The rate of deactivation strongly differs among the zeolites studied,decreasing in the order: Fe-beta > Fe-silicalite > FeZSM-5.\"\n          [5] \"The different deactivation behaviour of the various iron zeolites cannot be satisfactorily explained at this stage. The behaviour of FeZSM-5 points to the presence of active iron sites with different sensitivity for coke deactivation.\"\n          [6] \"Catalyst deactivation is a complex process, which may be caused by a series of various phenomena. In the simplest case, according to Moulijn et al. (2001), catalyst deactiva- tion can be caused by: (i) a decrease in the number of ac- tive sites, (ii) a decrease in the quality of the active sites,(iii) a decrease of accessibility of the pore space.\"", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been shown to be a superior oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) compared to other oxidants like oxygen (O2). Steam-activated iron zeolites (Fe-zeolites) have demonstrated high initial propene yields of 24% at temperatures between 773 and 798 K, which are comparable to the highest yields reported over vanadium (V) and molybdenum (Mo)-based catalysts using O2. The essential role of N2O in this process is highlighted by the fact that propene production does not occur when propane interacts with iron zeolites in the absence of N2O. The remarkable performance of Fe-zeolites is attributed to the specificity of N2O as a monooxygen donor and the capability of iron forms in the zeolite to coordinate reactive atomic oxygen species for efficient propane dehydrogenation. However, a major drawback is the deactivation by coke, causing a rapid decrease in propene yield. The rate of deactivation varies among the zeolites studied, with Fe-beta deactivating the fastest, followed by Fe-silicalite and FeZSM-5. The deactivation behavior of FeZSM-5 suggests the presence of active iron sites with different sensitivity for coke deactivation. Catalyst deactivation is a complex process that can be caused by a decrease in the number of active sites, a decrease in the quality of active sites, or a decrease in accessibility of the pore space.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮(N2O)已被证明是丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中比其他氧化剂如氧气(O2)更优越的氧化剂。蒸汽活化铁沸石(Fe-沸石)在773至798 K的温度下实现了24%的初始丙烯产量,这与使用O2的钒(V)和钼(Mo)基催化剂报告的最高产量相当。N2O在这一过程中的基本作用通过以下事实突出显示:当丙烷与铁沸石在没有N2O的情况下相互作用时,不会产生丙烯。Fe-沸石的显著性能归因于N2O作为单氧供体的特异性和沸石中铁形式协调反应性原子氧物种以有效脱氢丙烷的能力。然而,一个主要的缺点是由于焦炭导致的失活,导致丙烯产率的快速下降。失活速率在研究的沸石中差异很大,Fe-beta失活最快,其次是Fe-silicalite和FeZSM-5。FeZSM-5的失活行为表明存在对焦炭失活具有不同敏感性的活性铁位点。催化剂失活是一个复杂的过程,可能由一系列各种现象引起。最简单的情况下,根据Moulijn等人(2001)的说法,催化剂失活可能是由活性位点数量的减少、活性位点质量的降低或孔隙空间可及性的降低引起的。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.ces.2004.07.035"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The remarkable ODHP performance of iron zeolites has been related to the specificity of N2O as a mono-oxygen donor and to the ability of determined iron species for coordinating re- active atomic oxygen species able to efficiently dehydrogenate propane [4].\"\n          [2] \"A major drawback of iron zeolites in ODHP with N2O is the deactivation by coke, leading to a rapid de- crease of the propylene yield [4].\"\n          [3] \"The tapered element oscil- lating microbalance (TEOM) technique coupled with gas chro- matography (GC) analysis has proved to be a suitable tool for correlating deactivation and mass changes due to coking in the 0021-9517/$  see front matter  2007 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved. doi:10.1016/j.jcat.2007.04.010 124\"\n          [4] \"The level of detail and accuracy for in situ investigation of coke formation as obtained by TEOM cannot be accomplished using typical approaches to study deactivation, in which coke is characterized after exposing the catalyst to reaction condi- tions and taking samples at defined times for ex situ analyses [1416].\"\n          [5] \"However, TEOM does not provide information on the deactivation mechanism at the catalyst surface level, be- cause the nature of coke as well as its interaction with chemical groups in the zeolite cannot be probed.\"\n          [6] \"To gain a better under- standing of the deactivation of iron-containing zeolites in the C3H8 + N2O reaction and the subsequent regeneration in air,complementary spectroscopic studies under reaction conditions are needed.\"\n          [7] \"In situ FTIR spectroscopy is suitable for assessing coke deactivation of zeolite catalysts in hydrocarbon conversion [1720], by monitoring in real time the formation of carbona- ceous deposits and eventual changes in vibrations associated with the surface acidity and framework of the microporous ma- terial.\"\n          [8] \"Observing the evolution of the working catalyst under true process conditions is useful for an improved understanding of the ODHP reaction.\"\n          [9] \"To the best of our knowledge, in situ in- vestigations of selective oxidation of hydrocarbons with N2O over iron-containing zeolites have not been reported.\"\n          [10] \"Moreover, the reusability of the regenerated catalysts (i.e., to what extent the catalytic performance is recovered on successive re- action and regeneration cycles) has not yet been addressed in detail.\"\n          [11] \"Infrared results were complemented by TEOMGC exper- iments over the catalysts at the same conditions.\"\n          [12] \"The degree of catalyst reversibility on reaction and regeneration is evaluated and discussed on the basis of these analyses and characteri- zation of the fresh, coked, and regenerated samples by X-ray diffraction (XRD), transmission electron microscopy (TEM),and nitrogen adsorption.\"", "English": "N2O is a mono-oxygen donor that can efficiently dehydrogenate propane due to the ability of certain iron species to coordinate reactive atomic oxygen species. This specificity of N2O contributes to the remarkable performance of iron zeolites in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP). However, a major drawback of iron zeolites in ODHP with N2O is the deactivation by coke, which leads to a rapid decrease in propylene yield. The tapered element oscillating microbalance (TEOM) technique coupled with gas chromatography (GC) analysis has been used to correlate deactivation and mass changes due to coking. While TEOM provides detailed and accurate in situ investigation of coke formation, it does not provide information on the deactivation mechanism at the catalyst surface level. To gain a better understanding of the deactivation of iron-containing zeolites in the C3H8 + N2O reaction and the subsequent regeneration in air, complementary spectroscopic studies under reaction conditions are needed. In situ FTIR spectroscopy is suitable for assessing coke deactivation of zeolite catalysts in hydrocarbon conversion by monitoring the formation of carbonaceous deposits and changes in vibrations associated with the surface acidity and framework of the microporous material. Observing the evolution of the working catalyst under true process conditions is useful for an improved understanding of the ODHP reaction. However, in situ investigations of selective oxidation of hydrocarbons with N2O over iron-containing zeolites have not been reported. Moreover, the reusability of the regenerated catalysts has not yet been addressed in detail. Infrared results were complemented by TEOMGC experiments over the catalysts at the same conditions. The degree of catalyst reversibility on reaction and regeneration is evaluated and discussed on the basis of these analyses and characterization of the fresh, coked, and regenerated samples by X-ray diffraction (XRD), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), and nitrogen adsorption.", "Chinese": "N2O是一种单氧供体，由于某些铁物种能够协调反应性原子氧物种，因此可以有效地脱氢丙烷。N2O的这种特异性是铁沸石在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中表现出色的原因之一。然而，铁沸石在N2O-ODHP中的主要缺点是由于焦炭导致的失活，这会导致丙烯产量迅速下降。锥形元件振荡微平衡(TEOM)技术与气相色谱(GC)分析相结合，已被用于关联失活和由于焦化引起的质量变化。虽然TEOM提供了详细和准确的原位焦炭形成研究，但它不提供催化剂表面水平的失活机制信息。为了更好地理解铁沸石在C3H8 + N2O反应和随后的空气再生中的失活，需要在反应条件下进行补充的光谱学研究。原位FTIR光谱法适用于通过监测碳沉积物的形成和与微孔材料表面酸性和框架相关的振动变化来评估沸石催化剂在碳氢化合物转化中的焦炭失活。在真实工艺条件下观察工作催化剂的演变，对于改进对ODHP反应的理解是有用的。然而，关于铁沸石在N2O下选择性氧化碳氢化合物的原位研究尚未报道。此外，再生催化剂的可重复使用性(即，在连续的反应和再生循环中，催化性能恢复的程度)尚未详细讨论。红外结果通过在相同条件下对催化剂进行TEOMGC实验得到补充。基于这些分析和通过X射线衍射(XRD)、透射电子显微镜(TEM)和氮吸附对新鲜、焦化和再生样品的表征，评估和讨论了催化剂在反应和再生过程中的可逆性。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.jcat.2007.04.010"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Much research effort is currently devoted to the selective activation and functionalization of light alkanes (methane,ethane, propane, and butane) for obtaining petrochemicals directly or their respective olefinic feedstocks.\"\n          [2] \"Many studies have explored the catalytic oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) to propylene, a key building block in the petrochemical industry.\"\n          [3] \"Relatively complex multimetallic mixed oxides based on Vand Mo are considered as the most efficient catalysts in this reaction, with propene yields in the range of 1030% using O2 as the oxidant [1].\"\n          [4] \"As recently reported by three independent research groups [25], a promising alternative system for ODHP arises from the application of iron zeolites using N2O as the oxidant, leading to remarkable propylene yields at a substantially lower operation temperature (643773 K) in comparison with the mixed metal oxides (823923 K).\"\n          [5] \"The applied experimental condi- tions in [25] markedly differ with respect to temperature,feed composition, space velocity, and total pressure, so that a proper comparison between the various catalysts cannot be established.\"\n          [6] \"Besides, iron zeolites strongly deactivate during ODHP with N2O due to coke formation and it is unclear from these publications whether activities have been reported at a similar degree of deactivation and/or the same reaction time.\"\n          [7] \"The highest propylene yield was obtained over steam-activated Fe-ZSM-5 (22%), followed by the iron zeolites prepared by liquid-ion exchange (16%) and chemical vapor deposition (9%).\"\n          [8] \"The positive effect of steaming on the catalytic performance of iron zeolites for different conver- sions involving N2O, including direct decomposition [15],benzene hydroxylation [14,16,17], and propane oxidation [4,5] has been previously reported.\"\n          [9] \"The time and degree of deactivation in Fig. 2 depend on the catalyst in question.\"\n          [10] \"The relatively fast deactivation of lie-Fe-Z can be attributed to the presence of a relatively high number of Brnsted acid sites in the sample.\"\n          [11] \"The samples prepared by liquid-ion exchange and chemical vapor deposition contain high iron loadings and a marked contribution of large iron oxide particles, where the total combustion of reaction intermediates leading to the olefin appears to be favored.\"\n          [12] \"The coking profiles of the calcined and steamed commercial zeolites are very similar, leading to a final coke amount of ca. 5% (Fig. 2).\"\n          [13] \"The propylene yield is significantly higher in st-H-Z than in c-H-Z, although the propane conversion over both samples is rather similar (especially after 40 min on stream).\"\n          [14] \"This striking result strongly suggests that an extremely low number of iron sites is responsible of the observed performance.\"\n          [15] \"The decrease in TOF is steepest at molar Fe/Al ratios <0.5.\"\n          [16] \"This result further emphasizes the severe Fe- underutilization in the synthesized iron zeolites and that iron impurities in H-ZSM-5 play a decisive role in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (OHDP) with N2O.\"\n          [17] \"The vital role of iron impurities in the catalytic performance of H-ZSM-5 for the oxidation of benzene to phenol (BTOP) with N2O has been extensively examined in the literature, originally by the group of Panov [17], and more recently in excellent works of Kuba nek et al. [16] and Jia et al. [14].\"\n          [18] \"This reasoning can be extrapolated to the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane,as also explains the high propylene yields obtained by Bula nek et al. [5] over Fe-ZSM-5 with iron concentrations of 3001200 ppm.\"\n          [19] \"The current work has not specifically touched upon the role of acidity on the ODHP reaction, which may be important not only for the initial performance but also to understand and minimize catalyst deactivation.\"\n          [20] \"Our results show that deactivation is slower over the steam- activated zeolites (Fig. 2), with a significantly reduced number of Brnsted sites as a consequence of the steam treatment [21].\"\n          [21] \"A high number of protonic acid sites should catalyze coke formation, thus accelerating the zeolite deactivation, as suggested from the results over lie- Fe-Z.\"\n          [22] \"It is likely that the presence of a certain amount of acidic groups coexisting with extraframework iron species is beneficial for the reaction.\"\n          [23] \"Further research is required to elucidate the role of acidity in ODHP.\"", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been identified as a promising oxidant for the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) to produce propylene, a key petrochemical feedstock. Compared to traditional oxidants like oxygen, N2O allows for the production of propylene at lower temperatures, which can improve the efficiency and selectivity of the process. The use of N2O as an oxidant in ODHP has been shown to achieve remarkable propylene yields, particularly when iron zeolites are used as catalysts. These catalysts have been found to be effective at lower temperatures than those required for mixed metal oxide catalysts, which typically operate at higher temperatures. However, the performance of iron zeolites can vary significantly depending on the method of iron incorporation and the preparation technique. Steam activation of iron-substituted ZSM-5 zeolites has been shown to result in superior propylene yields compared to other preparation methods. Iron impurities in steamed commercial H-ZSM-5 zeolites have also been found to induce high propylene selectivity, leading to low COx formation. A major challenge in the use of N2O for ODHP is the deactivation of iron zeolite catalysts due to coke formation, which can limit the stability and lifetime of the catalyst. Strategies to address this limitation could include the development of more stable catalyst formulations, optimization of reaction conditions to minimize coke formation, and the use of in situ regeneration techniques to maintain catalyst activity. Research directions that could potentially make N2O-ODHP a more feasible option for practical implementation include the exploration of alternative iron sources and incorporation methods, the design of catalysts with enhanced resistance to deactivation, and the development of integrated process designs that incorporate catalyst regeneration steps.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮(N2O)已被确定为一种有前景的氧化剂,用于丙烷的氧化脱氢(ODHP)以生产丙烯,丙烯是关键的石化原料。与氧气等传统氧化剂相比,N2O允许在较低温度下生产丙烯,这可以提高过程的效率和选择性。N2O作为氧化剂在ODHP中的应用已被证明能够实现显著的丙烯产量,尤其是在使用铁沸石作为催化剂时。这些催化剂已被发现能在比混合金属氧化物催化剂所需的温度低得多的温度下有效,混合金属氧化物催化剂通常在较高温度下运行。然而,铁沸石在ODHP中的性能可能因铁的掺入方法和制备技术而显著不同。铁取代的ZSM-5沸石的蒸汽活化已被证明与其它制备方法相比,能产生更优的丙烯产量。在蒸馏的商业H-ZSM-5沸石中发现的铁杂质也被发现能诱导高丙烯选择性,导致低COx形成。在N2O用于ODHP时的一个主要挑战是由于焦炭形成导致的铁沸石催化剂失活,这可能限制催化剂的稳定性和寿命。解决这一局限性的策略可能包括开发更稳定的催化剂配方、优化反应条件以最小化焦炭形成,以及使用原位再生技术以维持催化剂活性。可能使N2O-ODHP成为更可行的实用实施选项的研究方向包括探索替代铁源和掺入方法、设计具有增强抗失活性的催化剂,以及开发整合过程设计,将催化剂再生步骤纳入其中。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.apcata.2004.10.020"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Using N2O as an oxidant may be an effective way to utilize N2O, which is an acidic, strong greenhouse gas.\"\n          [2] \"Using N2O as an oxidant instead of oxygen results in a significant increase in propylene selectivity for many different catalysts, including iron-containing zeolites and vanadium-based catalysts.\"\n          [3] \"While iron-based materials, such as Fe-ZSM-5, are found to be the catalysts that give the highest C3H6 yield for ODHP using N2O, other catalysts, including redox metal catalysts, such as vanadium and molybdenum, have been studied as well.\"\n          [4] \"However, despite the improved propylene selectivity, most of N2OODHP catalysts reported to date deactivate quickly, mainly because of coke formation, making N2O a currently less feasible oxidant than other soft oxidants, such as CO2.\"\n          [5] \"Therefore, improvement in catalyst stability and clear understanding of deactivation mechanisms remain challenges that need further study in the dehydrogenation of propane using N2O.\"", "English": "The use of nitrous oxide (N2O) as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) presents several advantages, particularly in terms of propylene selectivity compared to other oxidants. N2O, being a strong greenhouse gas, can be effectively utilized in this process, potentially offering environmental benefits. The substitution of N2O for oxygen leads to a significant increase in propylene selectivity across various catalysts, including iron-containing zeolites and vanadium-based catalysts. Iron-based materials, such as Fe-ZSM-5, have been identified as particularly effective in yielding high propylene (C3H6) in ODHP using N2O. Other redox metal catalysts, such as vanadium and molybdenum, have also been explored for this purpose. However, a critical challenge associated with the use of N2O in ODHP is the rapid deactivation of catalysts, primarily due to coke formation. This issue significantly limits the feasibility of N2O as an oxidant compared to softer oxidants like CO2. The quick deactivation of catalysts under N2O conditions necessitates further research to improve catalyst stability and to gain a clearer understanding of the deactivation mechanisms. Addressing these limitations could potentially make N2O-ODHP a more viable option for practical implementation. Strategies to overcome these limitations might include the development of more stable catalyst formulations, the optimization of reaction conditions to minimize coke formation, and the engineering of catalysts with enhanced resistance to deactivation. Additionally, in-depth studies to elucidate the precise mechanisms of deactivation could guide the design of more robust catalysts for N2O-ODHP processes.", "Chinese": "使用一氧化二氮（N2O）作为氧化剂在丙烷氧化脱氢（ODHP）中具有若干优势，尤其是在与其它氧化剂相比的丙烯选择性方面。N2O作为一种强温室气体，可以在此过程中得到有效利用，可能带来环境效益。用N2O代替氧气会导致各种催化剂的丙烯选择性显著提高，包括含铁的沸石和基于钒的催化剂。含铁材料，如Fe-ZSM-5，被发现是使用N2O在ODHP中产生高丙烯（C3H6）的特别有效的催化剂。其它还原金属催化剂，如钒和钼，也被用于此目的。然而，使用N2O在ODHP中的一个关键挑战是催化剂的快速失活，主要是由于焦炭的形成。这个问题极大地限制了N2O作为氧化剂的可行性，与更软的氧化剂如CO2相比。在N2O条件下催化剂的快速失活需要进一步的研究，以提高催化剂的稳定性，并对失活机制有更清晰的理解。解决这些限制可能会使N2O-ODHP成为更可行的实践实施选项。克服这些限制的策略可能包括开发更稳定的催化剂配方，优化反应条件以最小化焦炭的形成，以及设计具有增强抗失活性的催化剂。此外，深入研究以阐明失活的确切机制可以指导设计更坚固的N2O-ODHP过程催化剂。", "Doi": "10.1021/acscatal.0c03999_8"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Results obtained by adding gaseous promoters (CO2, N2O and H2) into the reaction feed are presented for two different reactions: (i) oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODP), and (ii) catalytic combustion of methane (CCM).\"\n          [2] \"The addition of 300 ppm N2O modifies the catalytic performances of the same catalyst in the same reaction by, principally: (i) decreasing the conversion of propane and oxygen, (ii) increasing the yield and the selectivity to propylene, and (iii) decreasing the yield and the selectivity to CO2.\"\n          [3] \"In the presence of N2O, catalytic sites work in a more reduced state and, consequently, in a more selective way.\"\n          [4] \"We have suggested that N2O could inhibit the adsorption of O2, thus limiting the formation of the non-selective oxygen species (from O2) and/or the oxidation rate of the catalysts.\"\n          [5] \"When the amount of N2O is higher than 300 ppm, another phenomenon probably takes place. Oxygen species coming from N2O dissociation could also play a role, suggesting that, while being less oxidant than O2, N2O is also able to induce the ODP.\"\n          [6] \"The important improvement in the selectivity due to the addition of N2O opens wide perspectives for the application of selective mesoporous catalysts.\"\n          [7] \"It seems that the principal consequences of the addition of N2O can be attributed to a decrease of the number of non-selective sites present on the supported mesoporous catalysts.\"\n          [8] \"One alternative explanation could be the fact that N2O inhibits the sites for non-selective propane activation, so leading to a lower conversion, while selectivity increases.\"\n          [9] \"The results obtained when the catalyst contains one monolayer of NiMoO4 were similar, but less significant (when 1 vol.% N2O is added,conversion decreases from 7.5 to 4.3% and selectivity increases from 34.8 to 41.9%).\"\n          [10] \"An interesting result was obtained with 1 (monolayer)-NiMoO4/[Si,V]-MCM-41 cat- alyst in the presence of 5 vol.% N2O only (i.e. without O2).\"\n          [11] \"In this case, the conversion of propane was 6.8% and the yield and the selectivity in propylene were 3.2 and 47.5%,respectively.\"\n          [12] \"However, the conversion of N2O was very low (only 0.5%).\"\n          [13] \"This result indicates that the propylene formed (3.2%) is not exclusively due to the ODP with N2O.\"\n          [14] \"Propylene is also formed by another mechanism, probably involving lattice oxygen from the catalyst.\"\n          [15] \"On the other hand, in the absence of O2, the catalysts show a very high amount of carbon.\"\n          [16] \"This observation indicates that the use of pure N2O to perform the ODP is not advisable.\"\n          [17] \"Molecular oxygen is necessary to oxidize and regenerate the catalysts in the presence of N2O, otherwise the catalyst deactivates quickly.\"\n          [18] \"N2O reduces the catalysts (molybdenum), explain- ing the high carbon formation.\"\n          [19] \"These results strongly suggest that: (i) a potential role of N2O in the presence of NiMoO4/[Si,V]-MCM-41 catalyst is to inhibit the non- selective sites, (ii) the formation of propylene by using pure N2O is very low, and (iii) it is the presence of both O2 and N2O (as promoter) that can fully explain the better selectivity of the catalysts in ODP, due to the modulation of their adequate oxidation state during the reaction.\"", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been shown to modify the catalytic performances of the same catalyst in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODP) reaction. Principally, it decreases the conversion of propane and oxygen, increases the yield and selectivity to propylene, and decreases the yield and selectivity to CO2. In the presence of N2O, catalytic sites work in a more reduced state, leading to a more selective reaction. When the amount of N2O is higher than 300 ppm, oxygen species coming from N2O dissociation could also play a role, suggesting that N2O is also able to induce the ODP, although less oxidant than O2. However, the use of pure N2O to perform the ODP is not advisable as molecular oxygen is necessary to oxidize and regenerate the catalysts in the presence of N2O, otherwise the catalyst deactivates quickly. N2O reduces the catalysts (molybdenum), explaining the high carbon formation. It is the presence of both O2 and N2O (as promoter) that can fully explain the better selectivity of the catalysts in ODP, due to the modulation of their adequate oxidation state during the reaction.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮（N2O）已被证明可以改变同一催化剂在丙烷氧化脱氢（ODP）反应中的催化性能。主要表现为降低丙烷和氧气的转化率，提高丙烯的产率和选择性，降低CO2的产率和选择性。在N2O存在下，催化位点处于更还原的状态，导致反应更具选择性。当N2O的量高于300 ppm时，来自N2O分解的氧物种也可能发挥作用，表明N2O虽然不如O2氧化性强，但也能诱导ODP。然而，仅使用N2O进行ODP是不可取的，因为在N2O存在下，需要分子氧来氧化和再生催化剂，否则催化剂会迅速失活。N2O会还原催化剂（钼），解释了高碳形成的原因。正是O2和N2O（作为促进剂）的存在，才能充分解释催化剂在ODP中更好的选择性，这是由于它们在反应过程中对催化剂适当氧化态的调节。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.cattod.2004.09.043"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"The improving effect of N2O on C3H6 selectivity is related to the lower ability of N2O for catalyst reoxidation resulting in an increase in the degree of catalyst reduction, i.e. spatial separation of active lattice oxygen in surface VOx species. Such separation favours selective oxidation over COx formation.\"\n          [2] \"C3H6 selectivity over V/g-Al2O3 materials is improved by covering the support fully with well-dispersed VOx species.\"\n          [3] \"Additionally, C3H6 selectivity over all materials studied can be tuned by using an alternative oxidising agent (N2O).\"\n          [4] \"The lower activity of N2O is explained by the lower ability of N2O for reoxidation of reduced VOx sites.\"\n          [5] \"This improving effect of N2O on propene selectivity is assumed to be due to the fact that catalyst reoxidation by N2O is less favourable than by O2.\"\n          [6] \"Such a decrease favours selective propane oxidation to propene over COx formation,since only one to two lattice oxygen are necessary in an active site for the former reaction. Active sites having more than two lattice oxygen species favour the formation of waste products,i.e. CO and CO2.\"\n          [7] \"The effect of the oxidising agent on the catalytic performance can be also related to the nature of oxygen species originating from O2 and N2O.\"\n          [8] \"Although direct experimental evidence is not available at this stage, it has been suggested that atomic oxygen species (O, O, O2) are responsible for selective oxidation, while polyatomic oxygen species (O2\n2, O3\n2) take part in COx formation.\"", "English": "The use of nitrous oxide (N2O) as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) has several advantages in terms of propylene selectivity compared to other oxidants. N2O's lower ability for catalyst reoxidation leads to an increase in the degree of catalyst reduction, which spatially separates active lattice oxygen in surface VOx species. This separation favors selective oxidation over the formation of COx. Propylene selectivity over V/g-Al2O3 materials can be improved by fully covering the support with well-dispersed VOx species. The selectivity can be further tuned by using N2O as an alternative oxidizing agent. The lower activity of N2O is due to its reduced ability to reoxidize reduced VOx sites, which enhances propene selectivity. This effect is attributed to the less favorable reoxidation of the catalyst by N2O compared to O2. The decrease in the steady-state concentration of active surface lattice oxygen of VOx species favors selective propane oxidation to propene over COx formation, as only one to two lattice oxygen are necessary for the former reaction. Active sites with more than two lattice oxygen species favor the formation of waste products like CO and CO2. The effect of the oxidizing agent on the catalytic performance is also related to the nature of oxygen species originating from O2 and N2O. It has been suggested that atomic oxygen species are responsible for selective oxidation, while polyatomic oxygen species take part in COx formation. However, direct experimental evidence is not available at this stage.", "Chinese": "在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中使用一氧化二氮(N2O)作为氧化剂,在丙烯选择性方面与其它氧化剂相比具有几个优势。N2O较低的催化剂再氧化能力导致催化剂还原程度的增加,即表面VOx物种中活性晶格氧的空间分离。这种分离有利于选择性氧化,而不是COx的形成。通过完全覆盖V/g-Al2O3材料的支撑,可以改善丙烯选择性。通过使用N2O作为替代氧化剂,可以选择性进一步调整。N2O的较低活性是由于其减少还原VOx位点的能力,从而增强了丙烯选择性。这种效应归因于N2O与O2相比,催化剂再氧化的不利影响。VOx物种活性表面晶格氧的稳态浓度的降低,有利于选择性丙烷氧化为丙烯,而不是COx的形成,因为前者反应只需要一个到两个晶格氧。具有超过两个晶格氧的活性位点有利于废物产品,即CO和CO2的形成。氧化剂对催化性能的影响也与O2和N2O产生的氧物种的性质有关。尽管目前没有直接的实验证据,但有人提出,原子氧物种负责选择性氧化,而多原子氧物种参与COx的形成。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.cattod.2005.11.028"},
{"Quotes": "Steam-activated FeZSM-5 (Si/Al = 31.3 and 0.67 wt % Fe) is a highly efficient catalyst for the N2O-mediated oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP), with propene yields up to 25% at 723 K, but strongly deactivates due to coke formation.\n          The remarkable ODHP performance of iron zeolites has been related to the specificity of N2O as a monooxygen donor and the capability of determined iron forms in the zeolite for coordinating reactive atomic oxygen species able to efficiently dehydrogenate propane.\n          A major drawback of iron zeolites in ODHP with N2O is the deactivation by coke, leading to a rapid decrease of the propene yield.\n          The initial (2022%) and final (710%) C3H6 yields showed no significant differences in the temperature range of 673773 K. However, the rate of deactivation is progressively reduced with an increase in temperature.\n          The relatively slow deactivation of FeZSM-5 at 773 K can be associated with the high N2O conversion measured after 400 min on stream (72%, see Figure 4).\n          Previous studies have concluded that the ODH of propane with O2 over FeZSM-5 leads to very low C3H6 yields (<5%) as compared to N2O.\n          The degree of C3H8 conversion (after 2 min on stream) was very similar in both cases (ca. 50%), but the C3H6 selectivity decreased from 46% to 22% upon O2 addition, leading to an increased amount of COx.\n          Such intermediates appear to be essential for propene production. Accordingly, the performance of FeZSM-5 in the N2O-mediated ODH of propane is severely deteriorated in the presence of small amounts of O2.\n          Because the initial ODHP performance was recovered upon air-regeneration of the spent catalyst, a process for continuous propylene production via alternation of reaction and regeneration cycles has been evaluated.\n          The participation of the oxidant in coke oxidation above a certain reaction temperature may also explain the similar final coke content obtained in FeZSM-5 at 723 and 773 K.\n          The results in Figure 7 differ from those reported by Bulnek et al.9 These authors concluded that although the propene selectivity over H-ZSM-5 (301200 ppm Fe) was decreased in N2O+O2 as compared to N2O, the propene yield was not significantly changed, due to the increased propene conversion in the presence of O2.\n          The efficient utilization of N2O in tail-gases should involve a previous purification step. As shown here, the presence of O2 (a typical component of tail-gases) has a negative impact on the N2O-mediated propane oxidative dehydrogenation to propylene over FeZSM-5.", "English": "N2O is a highly efficient oxidant for the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) over steam-activated FeZSM-5, achieving propene yields up to 25% at 723 K. The remarkable performance of iron zeolites in ODHP is attributed to the specificity of N2O as a monooxygen donor and the capability of iron forms in the zeolite to coordinate reactive atomic oxygen species for efficient dehydrogenation of propane. However, a major drawback is the deactivation by coke formation, leading to a rapid decrease in propene yield. The rate of deactivation is reduced with an increase in temperature, and the relatively slow deactivation of FeZSM-5 at 773 K is associated with high N2O conversion. The use of O2 as an oxidant in ODHP over FeZSM-5 leads to very low C3H6 yields (<5%) compared to N2O. The addition of small amounts of O2 to the C3H8+N2O mixture results in a decrease in C3H6 selectivity and an increase in COx production. The intermediates essential for propene production are negatively impacted by the presence of O2, severely deteriorating the performance of FeZSM-5 in N2O-mediated ODHP of propane. Strategies to address the limitations of catalyst deactivation and stability in N2O-ODHP include optimizing the reaction temperature to reduce deactivation rates, developing catalysts with improved resistance to coke formation, and exploring methods to regenerate the catalysts more efficiently. Research directions could focus on understanding the mechanisms of coke formation and identifying catalysts with active sites that are less susceptible to deactivation. Additionally, the development of cheap and selective catalyst systems for the low-temperature NH3 oxidation to N2O could provide a low-cost and reasonably pure source of N2O, making the process more feasible for practical implementation.", "Chinese": "N2O是过蒸汽活化FeZSM-5在氧化脱氢丙烷(ODHP)中的一种高效氧化剂，在723K时可达到25%的丙烯产量。铁沸石在ODHP中的优异性能归因于N2O作为单氧供体的特异性以及沸石中铁形式协调反应性原子氧物种以有效脱氢丙烷的能力。然而，一个主要缺点是由于焦炭形成导致的催化剂失活，导致丙烯产量迅速下降。失活速率随温度升高而降低，FeZSM-5在773K时的相对缓慢失活与高N2O转化率有关。在FeZSM-5上使用O2作为ODHP的氧化剂导致与N2O相比非常低的C3H6产量(<5%)。在C3H8+N2O混合物中添加少量O2导致C3H6选择性降低，COx产量增加。对丙烯生产至关重要的中间体受O2存在负面影响，严重恶化FeZSM-5在N2O介导的丙烷ODHP中的性能。解决N2O-ODHP中催化剂失活和稳定性限制的策略包括优化反应温度以降低失活速率，开发具有改善抗焦炭形成能力的催化剂，以及探索更有效地再生催化剂的方法。研究方向可以集中在理解焦炭形成机制和识别对失活不那么敏感的活性位点的催化剂上。此外，开发廉价和选择性的催化剂系统用于低温NH3氧化为N2O，可以提供低成本和相当纯净的N2O来源，使该过程更适用于实际应用。", "Doi": "10.1021/ie0493863"},
{"Quotes": "", "English": "The literature does not provide a direct comparison of N2O as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) with other oxidants in terms of propylene selectivity. However, it does state that N2O is more selective than molecular oxygen in other oxidation reactions. The literature discusses the use of nickel molybdate catalysts in the ODHP process and the effects of adding N2O as a gas dope on the catalytic performance. The addition of N2O modifies the catalytic performances, with a decrease in propane conversion, an increase in propylene yield and selectivity, and a decrease in oxygen consumption and CO2 yield at low concentrations of N2O. At higher concentrations of N2O, the selectivity in propylene decreases, and carbonaceous products are formed. The literature does not address the critical challenges associated with catalyst deactivation and stability in the N2O-ODHP process. However, it does suggest that adjusting the concentration of promoters like N2O could be a useful tool to modulate the oxidation state of oxide catalysts and improve their catalytic performances.", "Chinese": "文献没有直接比较N2O作为氧化剂在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)过程中的丙烯选择性与其他氧化剂。但是，它确实指出N2O在其他氧化反应中比分子氧更具选择性。文献讨论了镍钼催化剂在ODHP过程中的应用以及添加N2O作为气体助剂对催化性能的影响。添加N2O会改变催化性能，丙烷转化率降低，丙烯产率和选择性增加，氧气消耗和CO2产率降低，当N2O浓度较低时。当N2O浓度较高时，丙烯的选择性降低，形成碳质产物。文献没有讨论N2O-ODHP过程中与催化剂失活和稳定性相关的关键挑战。但是，它确实建议，调整N2O等促进剂的浓度可能是一种有用的工具，可以调节氧化物催化剂的氧化状态，从而改善其催化性能。", "Doi": "10.1016/S0926-860X(03)00103-0"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"Recently, it has been pro- posed to use nitrous oxide instead of dioxygen as oxidant, and the oxidative dehydrogenation of alkanes with N2O has attracted con- siderable attention [213].\"\n          [2] \"During the oxidative dehydrogenation of light alkanes with dioxygen, carbon oxides (CO and CO2) are extensively formed by over-oxidation even at moderate alkane conversions, resulting in low olefin selectivity and olefin yield [1].\"\n          [3] \"Iron-zeolites have been developed as unique catalysts for the oxidative dehydrogenation of light alkanes with N2O, especially the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane to propylene (ODHP).\"\n          [4] \"In our previous work, Fe-ZSM-5 prepared via a solid-state exchange method using ferrocene as iron precursor has been found to exhibit superior performance for the ODHP with N2O after a severe calcination.\"\n          [5] \"Catalyst deactivation is a key issue in the reaction of oxidative dehydrogenation, no matter whether dioxygen or nitrous oxide is used as oxidant.\"\n          [6] \"In the case of the ODHP with N2O, the presence of the propane reductant in the reaction system makes the conversion of nitrous oxide on iron-zeolites much more complicated.\"\n          [7] \"Another essential problem is the deactivation mecha- nism of catalysts in the ODHP with N2O.\"\n          [8] \"Accordingly, there is no effective means to prevent the deposition of coke and to increase the catalyst lifetime in the ODHP with N2O.\"", "English": "The use of nitrous oxide (N2O) as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) has gained significant attention as an alternative to dioxygen. The primary advantage of N2O is its ability to produce propylene with higher selectivity compared to dioxygen, which tends to over-oxidize propane, leading to the formation of carbon oxides (CO and CO2) and lower olefin yields. Iron-zeolites, particularly Fe-ZSM-5, have been developed as unique catalysts for this process, with Fe-ZSM-5 exhibiting superior performance for ODHP with N2O after severe calcination. However, catalyst deactivation remains a critical challenge in the ODHP process, regardless of the oxidant used. The presence of propane as a reductant complicates the conversion of nitrous oxide on iron-zeolites, and the deactivation mechanism of catalysts in ODHP with N2O is not fully understood. Strategies to address these limitations could include further research into the deactivation mechanisms, development of more stable catalysts, and optimization of reaction conditions to minimize coke formation and maximize catalyst lifetime. These efforts could potentially make N2O-ODHP a more feasible option for practical implementation.", "Chinese": "使用一氧化二氮(N2O)作为氧化剂在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中的应用已引起广泛关注，作为氧气的替代品。N2O的主要优势在于其能够以更高的选择性生产丙烯，与氧气相比，氧气倾向于过度氧化丙烷，导致二氧化碳(CO和CO2)的形成和较低的烯烃产量。铁沸石，特别是Fe-ZSM-5，已被开发为这种过程的独特催化剂，Fe-ZSM-5在N2O的ODHP中表现出优越的性能，经过严重煅烧。然而，催化剂失活仍然是ODHP过程中的一个关键挑战，无论使用哪种氧化剂。丙烷作为还原剂的存在使一氧化二氮在铁沸石上的转化复杂化，而N2O-ODHP中催化剂的失活机制尚未完全理解。解决这些限制的策略可能包括进一步研究失活机制，开发更稳定的催化剂，以及优化反应条件以最小化焦炭的形成并最大化催化剂的寿命。这些努力可能使N2O-ODHP成为更可行的实践实施选择。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.micromeso.2014.07.032"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"By replacement of O2 with N2O, overall activity decreased, while the selectivity towards propene formation increased for the same degree of propane conversion.\"\n          [2] \"Since N2O decomposition, over the studied mate- rials, is less favourable than O2 activation, a decrease in the steady-state concentration of active sites and an increase of the propene selectivity is achieved.\"\n          [3] \"A high selectivity to propene can be achieved by covering the support fully by well-dispersed vanadia species.\"\n          [4] \"The steady-state concentration of active lattice oxygen, which takes part in propane and propene activation, should be optimised to control selective ox- idation and combustion reactions. This was achieved by using N2O instead of O2.\"", "English": "The use of nitrous oxide (N2O) as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) has the advantage of increasing propylene selectivity compared to other oxidants. This is because N2O decomposition is less favorable than O2 activation, leading to a decrease in the steady-state concentration of active sites and an increase in propene selectivity. The efficiency of isolated VOx species for selective ODHP is superimposed by non-selective oxidation over the naked surface of the acidic support, which is not covered by active vanadia. To achieve high performance in ODHP, it is desirable to design catalytic surfaces that are fully covered by well-dispersed vanadia species to avoid the strong adsorption of propene on the support surface. The steady-state concentration of active lattice oxygen, which takes part in propane and propene activation, should be optimized to control selective oxidation and combustion reactions. Using N2O instead of O2 can achieve this optimization.", "Chinese": "在丙烷氧化脱氢（ODHP）中使用一氧化二氮（N2O）作为氧化剂，与其它氧化剂相比，具有提高丙烯选择性的优势。这是因为N2O分解不如O2激活有利，导致活性位点的稳态浓度降低，丙烯选择性增加。孤立VOx物种在选择性ODHP中的效率被非选择性氧化所叠加，这种氧化发生在未被活性矾覆盖的酸性支撑表面。为了在ODHP中实现高性能，设计催化表面是可取的，这些表面完全被分散良好的矾物种覆盖，以避免丙烯在支撑表面上的强烈吸附。参与丙烷和丙烯活化的活性晶格氧的稳态浓度应进行优化，以控制选择性氧化和燃烧反应。使用N2O代替O2可以实现这种优化。", "Doi": "10.1016/S0926-860X(01)00836-5"},
{"Quotes": "For all V/MCM-41 catalysts used in this study, higher propene selectivity is achieved with N2O as compared with O2 at similar degrees of C3H8 conversion.\n          The catalytic activity is lower, however, in the presence of N2O as com- pared with O2 because of the weaker oxidizing potential of N2O relative to O2 for the re-oxidation of the reduced surface VOx sites during the ODP reaction.\n          There is no significant difference in propene selectivity between highly dispersed surface VOx species and crystalline V2O5 nanoparticles when N2O is used as an oxidant.\n          In contrast to highly dispersed VOx on the surface of MCM-41, the crystalline V2O5 nanoparticles are not selective for the ODP reaction in the presence of O2.\n          The positive effect of N2O is related to the inhibition of direct C3H8 oxidation and the consecutive oxidation of C3H6 to COx.\n          The inhibition is ascribed to reducing surface density (spatial separation) of active surface lattice oxygen in VOx species, since N2O is a weaker oxidant for re-oxidation of reduced VOx species as compared with O2.\n          From a stoichiometric point of view of the ODP reaction, selective propene formation is favored over combustion reactions at lower surface densities.", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been found to be advantageous as an oxidant in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) due to its ability to achieve higher propene selectivity compared to molecular oxygen (O2) at similar degrees of propane conversion. This is attributed to the weaker oxidizing potential of N2O, which inhibits the direct oxidation of propane and the consecutive oxidation of propene to carbon oxides (COx). The use of N2O as an oxidant results in a lower catalytic activity due to its weaker ability to re-oxidize the reduced surface vanadium oxide (VOx) species. However, there is no significant difference in propene selectivity between highly dispersed surface VOx species and crystalline V2O5 nanoparticles when N2O is used as an oxidant. In contrast, crystalline V2O5 nanoparticles are not selective for the ODHP reaction in the presence of O2. The positive effect of N2O on propene selectivity is related to the reduction in surface density (spatial separation) of active surface lattice oxygen in VOx species, as N2O is a weaker oxidant for re-oxidation of reduced VOx species compared to O2. From a stoichiometric point of view, selective propene formation is favored over combustion reactions at lower surface densities.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮(N2O)已被发现作为氧化脱氢丙烷(ODHP)的氧化剂具有优势,因为它在与氧气(O2)相似的丙烷转化程度下,能够实现更高的丙烯选择性。这归因于N2O较弱的氧化电位,它抑制了丙烷的直接氧化和丙烯连续氧化为一氧化碳和二氧化碳(COx)。使用N2O作为氧化剂导致较低的催化活性,因为N2O较弱的能力重新氧化表面钒氧化物(VOx)的还原形式。然而,当N2O用作氧化剂时,高度分散的表面VOx物种和结晶V2O5纳米粒子之间在丙烯选择性上没有显著差异。相比之下,在O2存在下,结晶V2O5纳米粒子对ODHP反应没有选择性。N2O对丙烯选择性的正面影响与表面VOx物种中活性表面晶格氧的表面密度(空间分离)降低有关,因为N2O与O2相比,是一种较弱的氧化剂,用于还原VOx物种的重新氧化。从ODHP反应的化学计量观点来看,在较低的表面密度下,选择性丙烯形成比燃烧反应更受青睐。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.jcat.2005.05.025"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"In our recent studies of the ODP reaction over VOx/ g-Al2O3 [5] and VOx/MCM-41 [6] catalytic materials it was demonstrated that propene selectivity could be increased when O2 was replaced by N2O. The most significant improvements in propene selectivity (up to three times) were achieved for the sample possessing bulk like V2O5 species. It was suggested that the improved ODP performance with N2O was due to the lower ability of N2O for re-oxidation of reduced VOx species, i.e. the degree of catalyst reduction in the presence of N2O is higher than in the presence of O2.\"\n          [2] \"The results of steady-state ODP studies in Fig. 2 suggest a complex reaction scheme of parallel and consecutive steps for the ODP reaction using either O2 or N2O. The scheme is presented in Fig. 8. According to this scheme, the importance of direct (not via consecutive propene oxidation) propane oxidation to COx (mainly to CO2) is significantly higher in the presence of O2 than in N2O.\"\n          [3] \"The results in Table 4 indicate that a higher initial propene selectivity is achieved with N2O than with O2 for all the studied vanadium oxides using C3H8/N2O/Ne = 40/40/20 and C3H8/ O2/Ne = 40/20/40 reaction feeds.\"\n          [4] \"The difference between O2- and N2O-containing ODP feeds in the catalytic performance of vanadium oxides (Fig. 2, Table 4) may be partially related to the nature of active oxygen species originating from O2.\"\n          [5] \"The oxidizing agent tunes the catalytic performance of the studied vanadium oxides. As compared to O2-containing feeds, direct C3H8 oxidation to CO and CO2 (mainly) as well as consecutive C3H6 oxidation to COx are drastically reduced in the presence of N2O. The corresponding improved initial C3H6 selectivity can be related to the degree of reduction of vanadium sites; the higher the degree, the higher the selectivity. It is assumed that also the nature of oxygen species originated from O2 and N2O differs and plays a role in consecutive C3H6 and direct C3H8 oxidation.\"\n          [6] \"In our recent studies of the ODP reaction over VOx/ g-Al2O3 [5] and VOx/MCM-41 [6] catalytic materials it was demonstrated that propene selectivity could be increased when O2 was replaced by N2O. The most significant improvements in propene selectivity (up to three times) were achieved for the sample possessing bulk like V2O5 species. It was suggested that the improved ODP performance with N2O was due to the lower ability of N2O for re-oxidation of reduced VOx species, i.e. the degree of catalyst reduction in the presence of N2O is higher than in the presence of O2.\"\n          [7] \"For both oxidizing agents, propene selectivity decreases with an increase in propane conversion. This is due to a consecutive C3H6 oxidation to CO and CO2. However, these non-selective reaction pathways are influenced by the nature of oxidizing agent. From the results in Fig. 2(a) it is clear that propene selectivity decreases with an increase in the degree of propane conversion stronger with O2 than with N2O. For an O2- containing reaction feed, C3H6 selectivity decreases from 77 to 15% upon increasing C3H8 conversion from 0.6 to 9%. For similar changes in the degree of C3H8 conversion in the presence of N2O, C3H6 selectivity drops only from 86 to 60%.\"\n          [8] \"The reaction pathways of CO and CO2 formation are also influenced by the nature of oxidizing agent. It is clearly seen from the selectivityconversion plot in Fig. 2(b) that CO2 selectivity only slightly changes with varying degree of C3H8 conversion when O2 is used as oxidizing agent. It increases from 15 to 20% upon increasing C3H8 conversion from 0.6 to 9%. About 13% CO2 selectivity is expected upon extrapolation to a zero degree of propane conversion. Based on this observation and taking into account the small change of CO2 selectivity with varying degree of propane conversion in Fig. 2(b), it is concluded that carbon dioxide is mainly formed via direct propane combustion but not via consecutive propene oxidation. The latter reaction contributes to the total CO2 production only at high degrees of propane conversion. When O2 is replaced by N2O, CO2 selectivity decreases in the studied range of propane conversions (Fig. 2(b)). The decrease in CO2 selectivity is explained by a reduced tendency towards direct propane combustion. This conclusion is based on the fact, that a near-to-zero CO2 selectivity is expected for a zero degree of propane conversion in the presence of N2O (Fig. 2(b)). Upon increasing C3H8 conversion, CO2 selectivity increases, hence, CO2 is mainly formed via consecutive C3H6 oxidation when N2O is used as oxidizing agent.\"\n          [9] \"The selectivityconversion plot in Fig. 2(c) evidences that CO formation is stronger influenced by the degree of C3H8 conversion than CO2 formation. CO selectivity is very low (<5%) at zero C3H8 conversion but strongly increases with C3H8 conversion for both oxidants (N2O and O2). The obtained relationship indicates the secondary nature of CO formation,i.e. CO is formed via consecutive C3H6 oxidation. From Fig. 2(c) it is concluded that CO formation with O2 is stronger influenced by the degree of C3H8 conversion as compared to the tests with N2O. For an O2-containing feed, a relative difference in CO selectivity is 60% upon increasing C3H8 conversion from 0.6 to 9%, while the respective differencewith N2O is 20%.\"\n          [10] \"Summarizing the above discussion, it is concluded that catalytic performance and general scheme of the ODP reaction are determined by the applied oxidizing agent (O2 and N2O),but not by the initial composition of individual vanadium oxides.\"\n          [11] \"The results of steady-state ODP studies in Fig. 2 suggest a complex reaction scheme of parallel and consecutive steps for the ODP reaction using either O2 or N2O. The scheme is presented in Fig. 8. According to this scheme, the importance of direct (not via consecutive propene oxidation) propane oxidation to COx (mainly to CO2) is significantly higher in the presence of O2 than in N2O. Hence, the catalytic performance is determined by the oxidant activation, since this is a necessary stage for the heterogeneous reactions of partial oxidation [8,26].\"\n          [12] \"Based on the above discussion, the degree of reduction of vanadium species (bulk and surface) is suggested to be a key factor influencing initial propene selectivity. However, the reduction degree is not the only catalyst property, which determines the catalyst ability for consecutive propene oxidation to COx. This conclusion is based on the fact that the reduction degree of vanadium species in V2O5 after the ODP reaction using C3H8/N2O/Ne = 40/40/20 and C3H8/O2/ Ne = 40/10/50 feeds is similar (Table 3) but the catalytic performance is different (Fig. 9, Table 4). The difference between O2- and N2O-containing ODP feeds in the catalytic performance of vanadium oxides (Fig. 2, Table 4) may be partially related to the nature of active oxygen species originating from O2. To support this assumption, we performed transient experiments with isotopically labeled 18O2 using a SSITKA (steady-state isotopic transient kinetic analysis) technique. The idea is to follow distribution of non-labeled (16O) oxygen (lattice oxygen of vanadium oxides) and labeled (18O) oxygen (adsorbed oxygen) in carbon dioxide. The results are presented and discussed below.\"\n          [13] \"The oxidizing agent tunes the catalytic performance of the studied vanadium oxides. As compared to O2-containing feeds, direct C3H8 oxidation to CO and CO2 (mainly) as well as consecutive C3H6 oxidation to COx are drastically reduced in the presence of N2O. The corresponding improved initial C3H6 selectivity can be related to the degree of reduction of vanadium sites; the higher the degree, the higher the selectivity. It is assumed that also the nature of oxygen species originated from O2 and N2O differs and plays a role in consecutive C3H6 and direct C3H8 oxidation.\"", "English": "Nitrous oxide (N2O) has been shown to increase propylene selectivity in the oxidative dehydrogenation of propane (ODHP) compared to other oxidants like oxygen (O2). This improvement is attributed to the lower ability of N2O to re-oxidize reduced vanadium oxide (VOx) species, leading to a higher degree of catalyst reduction. The use of N2O can result in up to three times higher propylene selectivity compared to O2, especially when the catalyst contains bulk-like V2O5 species. N2O reduces the tendency for direct propane combustion and consecutive propene oxidation to COx, leading to improved initial propene selectivity. The nature of oxygen species originating from O2 and N2O also plays a role in the selectivity and activity of the catalyst.", "Chinese": "一氧化二氮(N2O)已被证明在丙烷氧化脱氢(ODHP)中提高丙烯选择性,与氧气(O2)等其他氧化剂相比。这种改进归因于N2O降低还原钒氧化物(VOx)物种的能力,导致催化剂还原度更高。使用N2O可以产生高达三倍的丙烯选择性,特别是当催化剂含有类似块状的V2O5物种时。N2O减少了直接丙烷燃烧和连续丙烯氧化为COx的倾向,从而提高了初始丙烯选择性。源自O2和N2O的氧物种的性质也在选择性和催化剂活性中发挥作用。", "Doi": "10.1016/j.apcata.2006.11.021"},
{"Quotes": "[1] \"In our recent studies of the ODP reaction over alumina- and silica-supported vanadia catalysts, 20,36 it was demonstrated that propene selectivity increases upon replacing O2 with N2O. Since the ODP activity with N2O was lower than with O2,20 we suggested that the degree of reduction of VOx species might be important for achieving high propene selectivity.\"\n          [2] \"The results of physicochemical characterization of VOx/SiO2, VOx/MCM-41, and VOx/MCM-48 materials; their catalytic performance in the ODP reaction; and redox dynamics of VOx species from in-situ UV/vis analysis are presented in sections 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3, respectively.\"\n          [3] \"The lower ability of N2O for reoxidation of reduced VOx species is also responsible for the lower ODP activity with N2O than with O2 as was previously suggested for VOx/MCM-4120 and VOx/γ-Al2O336 catalytic materials.\"\n          [4] \"The results of steady-state ODP studies suggest a complex reaction scheme of parallel and consecutive steps for the ODP reaction using either O2 or N2O. According to this scheme, C3H8 is directly converted to C3H6 and COx, with the latter reaction path playing a significant role for VOx(11.2)/MCM-41 sample possessing microcrystalline V2O5. The formed propene is further converted to CO and CO2. The importance of direct (not via consecutive propene oxidation) propane and consecutive propene oxidation to COx is significantly higher in the presence of O2 than in N2O. Hence, the catalytic performance is determined by the oxidant activation.\"\n          [5] \"Besides influencing the reduction degree of VOx species, N2O does not produce nonselective adsorbed oxygen species (possibly of biatomic nature), which are formed from O2 and catalyze nonselective consecutive propene oxidation to COx.\"\n          [6] \"The results of our detailed physicochemical
